title: Two Times Elliott typeface
content:
Might be a custom font, but I'm not sure. Any ideas?

Thanks!

Font: 

 Maison 

Solved By: 

 [R.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419014948/http:/typophile.com/user/57325 "View user profile.")

| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-10-20 at 12.08.11.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419014948/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-10-20%20at%2012.08.11.png) | 687.46 KB |
author: thinkingwithtype

comments.content:
This is [Maison](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419014948/http:/www.milieugrotesque.com/typeface-maison) by Timo Gaessner.

By the way: If you spot a webfont on a site, you can always check the source code to find out what it is. There are plugins to assist you with that, but in Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome you can simply select some letters of the typeface that you want to know, make a right click on them and select ‘Inspect element’. The specifications of the element will be shown in the bottom right corner of the screen.
Wow, that was quick. Thanks, R — I'll keep that in mind!
